Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact of the failure to pass a repeal bill on the number of Georgians below the poverty line who will not have access to insurance.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support to conclusively prove that the failure to pass a repeal bill will directly result in 300,000 Georgians below the poverty line not having access to the insurance promised by Obamacare.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or acknowledge that independent experts argue that the Republican replacement bills would not have solved the problem of lack of insurance access for low-income individuals, and may have even made it worse.
